CONJUGATES: customs (n. pl.) | customize (v.) | customized (v. past/pp) | custom-made (adj.)
ETYMOLOGY: From Old French costume (custom, habit), from Vulgar Latin consuetumen, based on Latin consuetudo (habit, usage), ultimately from consuetus (accustomed).

MEANINGS.DEF_EN: A traditional and widely accepted way of behaving or doing something specific to a particular society, place, or time.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 习俗；惯例；风俗。一个特定社会、地点或时间普遍接受的行为或做事方式。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: It is the custom in many European countries to have dinner quite late.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 在许多欧洲国家，很晚吃晚餐是一种习俗。

MEANINGS.DEF_EN: Made or designed specifically for a particular customer or user; bespoke or tailor-made.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 定制的；量身定做的。专为特定客户或用户制作或设计的。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The client required a custom software solution for managing their inventory.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 客户需要一个定制的软件解决方案来管理他们的库存。

MEANINGS.DEF_EN: The official department responsible for collecting duties and controlling the flow of goods into and out of a country.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 海关；关税。负责征收关税和控制货物进出国家流动的官方部门。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: We had to open our bags for inspection at customs.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 我们必须在海关打开行李接受检查。

MEANINGS.DEF_EN: Regular support or patronage given by customers to a business.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 惠顾；生意。顾客对某家企业给予的经常性支持或光顾。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The shop lost a lot of custom when the large chain store opened nearby.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 附近的大型连锁店开业后，这家商店失去了很多生意。
